properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued January 9 at 2:00AM EST until January 12 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible.

* WHERE...Bay, Huron, Tuscola and Sanilac Counties.

* WHEN...From Saturday morning through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Low lying property including homes, businesses, and
some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline
erosion may occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of northeast gales are expected
Saturday and Saturday night. With wind gusts on the lake
possibly over 40 MPH and the high water levels, rising water
levels and wave action may cause significant shoreline flooding.
Low lying areas along Saginaw Bay will be particularly
susceptible. The flooding is also likely to extend up the
Saginaw River into Bay City.
properties.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
